popt4jlib.neural

Class Sigmoid

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.neural.BaseNNNode
      • popt4jlib.neural.Sigmoid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, NNNodeIntf, OutputNNNodeIntf

    public class Sigmoid
extends BaseNNNode
implements OutputNNNodeIntf
    Sigmoid implements the 1/(1+exp(-ax)) function as activation function of a node. The class knows how to differentiate itself when gradient information is required via the evalPartialDerivativeB() methods that essentially implement automatic differentiation for FeedForward Neural Networks. Can be used as hidden layer node or output layer node.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2020

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double eval(double[] inputSignals, double[] weights)
      Given arguments two vectors x and y, return 1 / (1 + exp(-a(<x,y>))).
      double eval(double[] inputSignals, double[] weights, int offset)
      same as eval(s,w) method, but the 2nd argument is now assumed to hold all the network weights.
      double eval(double[] inputSignals, double[] weights, int offset, double true_label)
      called when the node is used as output node, simply calls eval(inputSignals,weights,offset).
      double evalB(double[] inputSignals, double[] weights)
      Given arguments two vectors x and y, return 1 / (1 + exp(-a(<x,y[0:x.len-1]>+y[x.len]))).
      double evalB(double[] inputSignals, double[] weights, int offset)
      same as evalB(s,w) method, but the 2nd argument is now assumed to hold all the network weights including biases.
      double evalB(double[] inputSignals, double[] weights, int offset, double true_label)
      called when the node is used as output node, simply calls evalB(inputSignals,weights,offset).
      double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] weights, int index, double[] inputSignals, double true_lbl)
      evaluates the partial derivative of this node (as a function of weights) with respect to the weight variable whose weight is given by the value of the weights array in the given index, using the grad-vector thread-local cache.
      double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] weights, int index, double[] inputSignals, double true_lbl, java.util.HashMap p)
      evaluates the partial derivative of this node (as a function of weights) with respect to the weight variable whose weight is given by the value of the weights array in the given index.
      java.lang.String getNodeName()
      get this node's name.
      private double sPrime(double x)
      the derivative of the sigmoid function as a function of one variable.

      • evalPartialDerivativeB

        public double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] weights,
                                     int index,
                                     double[] inputSignals,
                                     double true_lbl,
                                     java.util.HashMap p)
        evaluates the partial derivative of this node (as a function of weights) with respect to the weight variable whose weight is given by the value of the weights array in the given index. The derivative for this node exists everywhere (the sigmoid function is an analytic function).
        Specified by:
        evalPartialDerivativeB in interface NNNodeIntf
        Overrides:
        evalPartialDerivativeB in class BaseNNNode
        Parameters:
        weights - double[] all variables (including biases) array
        index - int the index of the partial derivative to take
        inputSignals - double[]
        true_lbl - double
        p - HashMap includes the train-data matrix and train-labels array
        Returns:
        double

      • evalPartialDerivativeB

        public double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] weights,
                                     int index,
                                     double[] inputSignals,
                                     double true_lbl)
        evaluates the partial derivative of this node (as a function of weights) with respect to the weight variable whose weight is given by the value of the weights array in the given index, using the grad-vector thread-local cache. The derivative for this node exists everywhere (the sigmoid function is an analytic function).
        Specified by:
        evalPartialDerivativeB in interface NNNodeIntf
        Overrides:
        evalPartialDerivativeB in class BaseNNNode
        Parameters:
        weights - double[] all variables (including biases) array
        index - int the index of the partial derivative to take
        inputSignals - double[]
        true_lbl - double
        Returns:
        double
